channel.title: NYT > Most Popular
channel.copyright: Copyright 2026 The New York Times Company

item.title: Catherine O’Hara, ‘Home Alone’ and ‘Schitt’s Creek’ Actress, Dies at 71
item.description: An Emmy-winning comedian with oddball charm, she got her start with the influential Canadian sketch comedy series “SCTV.”
item.dc:creator: Alex Williams and Rylee Kirk
item.media:credit: Ryan Pfluger for The New York Times

item.title: Bovino Is Said to Have Mocked Prosecutor’s Jewish Faith on Call With Lawyers
item.description: Gregory Bovino, the Border Patrol field leader, made disparaging remarks in reference to the U.S. attorney in Minnesota, an Orthodox Jew, people with knowledge of the phone call said.
item.dc:creator: Ernesto Londoño and Hamed Aleaziz
item.media:description: Gregory Bovino at a news conference in Minneapolis earlier this month.

item.title: How Trump Appears in the Epstein Files
item.description: The New York Times found more than 5,300 files with references to Mr. Trump and related terms. They include salacious and unverified claims, as well as documents that had already been made public.
item.dc:creator: Steve Eder, Michael C. Bender and David Enrich
item.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
item.media:description: President Donald Trump in the Oval Office on Friday.

item.title: Trump, in an Escalation, Calls for Republicans to ‘Nationalize’ Elections
item.description: The comments, made on a conservative podcast, follow a string of moves from his administration to try to exert more control over American elections.
item.dc:creator: Reid J. Epstein and Nick Corasaniti
item.media:credit: Caroline Yang for The New York Times
item.media:description: President Trump has long been fixated on the false claim that voter fraud is rampant in the United States.

item.title: ‘Melania’ Arrives With Strong Box Office Showing for a Documentary
item.description: Amazon backed up the Brink’s trucks for the vanity film, resulting in weekend ticket sales of about $7 million in North America, enough for third place.
item.dc:creator: Brooks Barnes
item.media:description: The first lady, Melania Trump, at a screening of “Melania” at the Kennedy Center in Washington on Thursday.

item.title: They Said They Weren’t Close to Epstein. New Documents Show Otherwise.
item.description: Materials released by the Justice Department revealed that leading business and political figures had enduring relationships with the disgraced financier.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Confessore
item.media:description: The Justice Department released millions of pages of new documents related to Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Nervous Allies and Fox News: How Trump Realized He Had a Big Problem in Minneapolis
item.description: President Trump often blusters his way through a crisis, refusing to back down. Minneapolis tested the limits of that strategy.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Pager, Katie Rogers, Zolan Kanno-Youngs and Hamed Aleaziz
item.media:description: President Trump has honed a survival tactic over many years facing criticism in the public eye.

item.title: ‘Today’ Anchor Savannah Guthrie’s Mother Is Missing, Authorities Say
item.description: Savannah Guthrie’s mother, Nancy, 84, was last seen on Saturday at her home in Tucson, Ariz. A sheriff said that investigators were treating her disappearance as a crime.
item.dc:creator: Claire Moses and Christine Hauser
item.media:description: Savannah Guthrie and her mother, Nancy Guthrie, on the “Today” show set in 2023.

item.title: Democratic Upset in Deep Red Texas District Rattles Republicans
item.description: A Democrat won a state legislative special election in a district that President Trump carried by 17 percentage points, unnerving Republicans in Texas and beyond.
item.dc:creator: J. David Goodman
item.media:credit: Desiree Rios for The New York Times
item.media:description: Taylor Rehmet, a Democratic candidate for the Texas Senate, in Fort Worth in January.

item.title: ICE Expands Power of Agents to Arrest People Without Warrants
item.description: An internal memo changed the standard from whether people are unlikely to show up for hearings to whether they could leave the scene.
item.dc:creator: Hamed Aleaziz and Charlie Savage
item.media:credit: Victor J. Blue for The New York Times
item.media:description: Federal agents attempted to raid a home in Minneapolis earlier this week.

item.title: Best and Worst Moments From the 2026 Grammys
item.description: Addison Rae tapped into 2000s pop energy, Justin Bieber stripped things down and Bad Bunny got choked up at the 68th annual awards.
item.dc:creator: Jon Pareles, Lindsay Zoladz and Joe Coscarelli
item.media:description: Sabrina Carpenter performing “Manchild” early in the ceremony.

item.title: Don Lemon Released Without Bond Over Minnesota Church Protest
item.description: Nine people have been accused of violating federal law during the demonstration at a church this month, reviving a case that was rejected last week by a magistrate judge.
item.dc:creator: Hamed Aleaziz, Devlin Barrett, Alan Feuer and Jesus Jiménez
item.media:description: Don Lemon has defended his actions at a church in St. Paul, Minn., as “an act of journalism.”

item.title: Gabbard Arranges Trump Call With FBI Agents After Georgia Election Center Search
item.description: Tulsi Gabbard, the director of national intelligence, brokered the call and President Trump directly questioned frontline agents on the inquiry, The Times has learned.
item.dc:creator: William K. Rashbaum, Devlin Barrett and Julian E. Barnes
item.category: Georgia Criminal Case Against Trump (2020 Election)
item.media:credit: Nicole Craine for The New York Times
item.media:description: The director of national intelligence, Tulsi Gabbard, wearing a coat and dark cap, at the Fulton County elections office in Fairburn, Ga., last week.

item.title: The Government Published Dozens of Nude Photos in the Epstein Files
item.description: The photos, which showed young women or possibly teenagers with their faces visible, were largely removed after The New York Times began notifying the Justice Department.
item.dc:creator: Mike Baker and Julie Tate
item.media:description: An undated photo of Jeffrey Epstein that was released by the Justice Department.

item.title: ‘They Couldn’t Break Me’: A Protester, the White House and a Doctored Photo
item.description: President Trump and the White House regularly circulate imagery that has been manipulated by A.I. But the photo of Nekima Levy Armstrong was different.
item.dc:creator: Erica L. Green
item.media:credit: Victor J. Blue for The New York Times
item.media:description: Nekima Levy Armstrong was arrested for protesting in St. Paul, Minn. She said she learned about the doctored photograph of her while she was in jail, during a phone call with her husband.

item.title: 6 Takeaways from ‘Melania,’ the Melania Trump Documentary
item.description: The film, which counts Melania Trump as a producer, touches on her immigrant roots, her love for her mother and her style, but there are few revelations.
item.dc:creator: Melena Ryzik

item.title: Clintons Capitulate on House Epstein Inquiry, Agreeing to Testify
item.description: Former President Bill Clinton and Hillary Clinton, the ex-secretary of state, agreed to depositions they had long resisted days before the House was to vote to hold them in contempt.
item.dc:creator: Annie Karni
item.category: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform
item.media:description: Lawyers for former President Bill Clinton and Hillary Clinton, the former secretary of state, made an offer for Mr. Clinton to testify before the House Oversight Committee after initially refusing.

item.title: Slovenian Sphinx Flick Nixed!
item.description: Melania’s movie, not exactly boffo box office.
item.dc:creator: Maureen Dowd

item.title: A Farewell Column From David Brooks
item.description: After 22 wonderful years, I’ve decided to take the exciting and terrifying step of leaving in order to try to build something new.
item.dc:creator: David Brooks
item.media:credit: Chris Maggio for The New York Times

item.title: Shooting Aftermath Leaves Homeland Security Department in Turmoil
item.description: As officials point fingers in the wake of Alex Pretti’s death at the hands of federal agents, concerns grow about the agency’s future.
item.dc:creator: Zolan Kanno-Youngs and Hamed Aleaziz
item.media:credit: Victor J. Blue for The New York Times
item.media:description: Federal agents clearing protesters from a hotel in Minneapolis on Sunday night.
